values:
There is always something special about a Wednesday...
It's such a formal yet casual sort of a day.... A day for sport and a day for fun... Mr. Howell agrees with me and says I look good in anything..... But no matter. ( He's so cute!) It always calls for pearls with a touch of casual cotton. Opera gloves are optional girls... As long as you have an escort for dinner you will do nicely. Mr. Howell and the Skipper went for a walk to the other side of the island to check up on the Professor and Gilligan.(Which gives me time ot flatten out his Wallstreet Journal.) The Professor is looking for some sort of a sea shell or something to use for recharging batteries or someting like that. And Gilligan was helping him. Poor professor....he tries so hard.
The Girls and I are working on a new weaving sort of thing for some new clothes. The Professor is such a genius and has found that the leaves from some sort of tree here can be dried and made into a silky cotton sort of material. We're not that sure but were going to give it a try anyhow... Ginger says it will be great for making me a new hat. But Im not all that sure about clothes from it. seems a little rough to me. We'll see... Well, that's all for Wednesday.... We're getting ready for the our Fourth of July celebration.... That should be great fun! Oh one last thing.... Please check out this fabulous place I have just discovered
Jewlrey girls!
LOVEY

Recently a very new friend of mine sent me a notice for some real fun that he has arranged in August. Gilligans Island The Musical by our dear friend Sherwood Schwartz. My friend received the production rights from Lloyd Schwartz. And his local theater group in Ohio will be one of the first amateur groups to produce it. In the production, He will be playing the part of the Professor. I sincerely hope that everyone can attend... I know that I will be there and look forward to seeing all my friends there!!!
The Village Players of Hicksville, Ohio
Proudly Present
August 15, 16, 17, 22, 23 & 24 At The Huber Opera House & Civic Center Hicksville, Ohio
Read more: In 1980 Sherwood Schwartz had seen Annie in New York. It was then in the third year of it's run on the Broadway stage. Annie had just become the eighth longest-running musical in Broadway history. He was inspired by this as he felt that Gilligan like Annie had become a part of American Pop Culture and would be a perfect vehicle to become a Broadway Musical. Some time passed, then. Sherwood asked United Artist, the studio that had originally bankrolled the series, if they were interested in a musical version of Gilligan's Island for Broadway. Unfortunately, United Artist had bankrolled two Broadway plays the previous season, and both investments had proven disastrous. So the Musical waited. After some time past a few years. Then Sherwood started up again on the project. at some point Sherwoods son in law, Laurence Juber (Lead Guitarist for Paul McCartney's group Wings. was brought in and the project began to gain speed. It became a family affair for Lloyd and Sherwood Schwartz, his daughter Hope and her husband Laurence. Lloyd and Sherwood worked on the book, Laurence and Hope worked on the score. It was a very close collaboration. After about a year it was ready for some workshop performances. Then around 1988 More work..and more workshop performances came and went....and right on thru 1992. It's world premiere was in June 1992 (eleven years ago) at the Flat Rock Playhouse in North Carolina. The Audience loved it and so did the critics. Then the Musical went on to open in Chicago that November. Since that time it's popped up all over....in California and in Hawaii.... Well.... That's all for today, LOVEY
Stay tuned.....

Good day Castaways, Today Im going about smelling the flowers and cutting a few for our guests.
Thats right! We will be having some visitors joining us here in the island for a few days....
So we must all be on our best behavior...
. Please let us all enjoy ourselves.... ~LOVEY~

It's so difficult being rich.... If it wern't for the money, I'd rather be poor. My Thurston said that. He's such a philosophic genius! Im just getting oriented here in Livejournal. So, please be patient with me. Now it has been nearly 40 years here on this island....(oh now were not always on it anymore.) Just sometimes. 40 years ago and things haven't really changed that much. Well, it's Sunday and time for tea. I must go now. But please stay do come back and I will fill you in on quite a few details. I look forward to reading and chatting with you all. And I will remain Affectionately always, LOVEY
